title: As Hours Dwindled Before Flight Cuts, the Government Was Publicly Mum
summary: Airlines did not wait for an announcement, notifying passengers and airports of expected changes before the Trump administration made official its list of affected airports.

title: What Travelers Need to Know About the Shutdown, Flight Reductions and Delays
summary: As the government shutdown continues, more challenges await passengers as they deal with the newest announcement from the Trump administration: a 10 percent cut in flights at 40 U.S. airports.

title: Airlines Rush to Prepare for Federal Reductions in Flights
summary: Airline planning and scheduling teams went into overdrive to identify which flights to cut while minimizing consequences for customers, pilots, flight attendants and the bottom line.

title: A Nerve-Racking Week for SNAP Recipients, and Elon Musk’s $1 Trillion Pay Deal
summary: Plus, the Friday news quiz.

title: The Job Market Is Cooling but Not Collapsing, According to Private Data
summary: The federal government shutdown canceled a second straight jobs report, but private data sources suggest the labor market has weakened modestly since summer.

title: The Fed’s Recent Rate Decisions Have Been Divisive. It Is Likely to Get Worse.
summary: The last three policy votes have featured some form of dissent, as officials grapple with how to weigh a softening labor market and resurgent inflation.

title: Mass Layoffs Are Scary, but Probably Not a Sign of the A.I. Apocalypse
summary: Despite fears that Amazon and other employers are already replacing workers with bots, the A.I. transition is likely to play out differently.

title: Why Germany Is Still Divided When It Comes to Russia
summary: Many East Germans are more sympathetic toward Moscow than their western compatriots, reflecting decades of Soviet ties and disillusionment since reunification.

title: Russian Jailed for Placing Tiny Antiwar Signs in a Market Says She Would Do it Again
summary: Freed in a major prisoner swap, Aleksandra Skochilenko said “the values of freedom of speech, of peace, could be more important than spending even 10 years in jail.”

title: Russian Sanctions Risk Straining Trump’s Chummy Relationship With Hungarian Leader
summary: New U.S. penalties on Russian energy could be a sticking point as President Trump and Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary meet.

title: The Sierra Club Embraced Social Justice. Then It Tore Itself Apart.
summary: The environmental group gave up its singular focus on climate change for a broader agenda. The ensuing internal strife left it weakened as it takes on the Trump administration.

title: Mamdani Wants to Tax the Rich. Can He Persuade State Leaders?
summary: After an impressive victory, Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani now must find funds for his programs. His push for higher taxes puts Gov. Kathy Hochul, who faces a re-election fight, in a tough spot.

title: Rent-Stabilized to Rent-Free? Mamdani Could Be Headed to Gracie Mansion.
summary: Five bedrooms. A ballroom. A full-time chef. The official mayoral residence in New York City could not be more different from Zohran Mamdani’s current home.

title: As Saudi Arabia Cracks Down on Drugs, Executions Near a Record High
summary: Facing an influx of amphetamines, the kingdom has put hundreds of people to death, many of them foreigners convicted of low-level smuggling.

title: The 2025 New York Times/New York Public Library Best Illustrated Children’s Books
summary: Take a peek at this year’s winners.

title: As Idaho Grows Ever Redder, Boise Worries About Its Isolation
summary: Two city councilors won re-election on Tuesday, though their support for a pride flag at City Hall had sparked challenges from the right. Still, Idaho’s deep embrace of President Trump has the city worried.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Leave Swiss Farmers With Too Much Milk
summary: The country’s dairy farmers produced a bumper harvest of milk, but higher U.S. duties have forced them to consider ways to cut back, including slaughtering cows.

title: Trump’s Tariffs Scar Canadian City Where Cars Have Been Made for Decades
summary: An automaker’s decision to shift Canadian jobs to the United States has left workers in Brampton, Ontario, feeling betrayed and angry.

title: China’s Exports Unexpectedly Falter as Prices Keep Falling
summary: Exports of cars, solar panels and batteries remain strong, but prices are falling because of factory overcapacity in China.

title: Japanese Automakers Warn of Billions in Tariff Losses
summary: Toyota, Honda and Nissan forecast big hits to their profits from higher tariffs that they acknowledged were likely ‘here to stay.’

title: Nancy Pelosi's Rise From Stay-at-Home Mom to House Speaker
summary: The daughter of a politician, she didn’t expect to become one. But once she ran for office in 1987, there was no stopping her.

title: San Francisco Sees Nancy Pelosi as a Tireless Leader for the City
summary: Representative Nancy Pelosi, after announcing her retirement, was praised by many San Franciscans for her tireless efforts on behalf of the city. Some of her work went unheralded.

title: More Democrats Need to Follow Pelosi’s Example and Retire
summary: She has shown herself more willing than most to put aside her own ego for the greater good.

title: ‘The Jitterbug Seems Justified!’: 3 Writers on Democratic Elation and G.O.P. Alarm
summary: What both parties should take away from a night of Democratic victories.

title: Late Night Laments the Effects of the Longest-Ever Government Shutdown
summary: Stephen Colbert advised that anyone traveling for Thanksgiving “might want to leave now.”

title: Lawsuits Blame ChatGPT for Suicides and Harmful Delusions
summary: Seven complaints, filed on Thursday, claim the popular chatbot encouraged dangerous discussions and led to mental breakdowns.

title: U.S. Sends Attack Aircraft to El Salvador Amid Regional Troop Buildup
summary: A New York Times analysis of satellite imagery and air traffic control communications found that U.S. military planes began operating out of the Central American country in mid-October.

title: In N.B.A. Betting Scandal, Internet Touts Played Old Game in a New Form
summary: A Supreme Court decision created a sports gambling industry now worth $14 billion. Many are angling for a cut.

title: Former King of Spain, Juan Carlos, Details Death of Brother in Memoir
summary: He wrote about the accident that killed his brother nearly 70 years ago. The book also describes his respect for Gen. Francisco Franco, the former dictator.
